column2: # transform target outcome to indicate whether the student has dropped out or not
# converting categorical variables to factors when necessary
# this will make sure R creates dummy variables to represent each possible
# category rather than treating the values numerically
# run a glm on the student data (without covariates)
# run a glm on the student data (with covariates)
# output the summary for all models

glm(formula = Target ~ `Daytime/evening attendance\t`, family = binomial, 
    data = student_data)
Null deviance: 5554.5  on 4423  degrees of freedom
Residual deviance: 5527.0  on 4422  degrees of freedom

glm(formula = Target ~ `Daytime/evening attendance\t` + `Age at enrollment` + 
    `Marital status` + Debtor + `Scholarship holder`, family = binomial, 
    data = student_data)
Null deviance: 5554.5  on 4423  degrees of freedom
Residual deviance: 4876.0  on 4414  degrees of freedom
